headline: Yum Brands (YUM) Valuation Check After Earnings Beat Dividend Hike And Rising Digital Sales
summary: Yum! Brands (YUM) is back in focus after fourth quarter 2025 results modestly topped Wall Street revenue expectations, supported by strong KFC and Taco Bell performance, rising digital sales, and a higher quarterly dividend. See our latest analysis for Yum! Brands. At a share price of $160.57, Yum! Brands has cooled slightly from its recent all time high of $163.71. It has a 90 day share price return of 8.47% and a 1 year total shareholder return of 10.66%, suggesting momentum that has built...
